intro: Psychotria rubripilis, commonly known as the "red-haired" Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, reddish hairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria rubripilis is also known for its toxic alkaloids, which have been studied for their potential medicinal and hallucinogenic properties.
